tweets.text: @colinmegill I am not sure where the line is, but “reusable for me” (in Vue) is one thing but “reusable for everyone” thru Observable is another, and I prefer the latter for more iterative ideas, I can publish Vue components but then I am in a dialect not the lingua franca
@colinmegill sometimes "client" is me, though- but yes, it really is my notebook  where I feel comfortable "sketching" and Vue is like the huge canvas where you wanna measure twice and cut once
@colinmegill way easier to surface sliders / iterate on prototypes / let the client play with parameters, the Vue step is sort of locking it in, locking it in too early is sub-optimal
got my latest greatest hit on repeat: "got it working in Observable, now to get it working in Vue"
@MAKIO135 also the rule is that if anyone says "I like that" you have to immediately take it down and give it to them
@MAKIO135 yes and then usually take it down yearly, you end up doing daily self-crit on it, all of that shows up in the new pieces
spun up a minecraft server for me and my friends and checking the game out again after like... 6 years? perfect game to tune out the world
@FrankElavsky Ah, the ol’ (non-pejorative) human chartjunk
@d_lassig @JordanWildon Really interested in the graph angle- would love to take the data generated by this tool and find a way to easily generate Gephi / .gexf files from it
RT @amandacox: Lesson: Something done quickly might win / change your life.
i made my a keyboard macro to write `=>` for me which doesn't seem like a lot but really makes you feel powerful when writing javascript
same energy https://t.co/M0JBRt3DK8
it took me 4 days to do 2 days of work
Props to @patio11, @stripe, and team https://t.co/gqdFFL3ukd
oh okay https://t.co/jorkkX6zc5

They might claim ignorance or inevitability but every person who works in media makes a choice when they decide what and what not to cover- and many are making a conscious decision that they can hide behind plausible deniability

Hey guys... so you know those sedition-sympathizer Capitol police officers who basically opened the doors for fascists... believe it or not... there are similar characters working for mainstream "objective" news organizations, particularly local TV https://t.co/t6QeCARix7
what i really want to do is ask my friends to take pictures of the event so i can evaluate if i can handle it

@NathanIHarris @enjalot @janezhgw @sxywu That is exactly how I work. Each milestone is time estimated in my SOW. This also comes from spending years getting a good idea of how long things take, and always following the rule of doubling my estimate to be safe. Clients love it when you come under estimate for milestone.

@enjalot @janezhgw @sxywu I don't think I could ever ever do fixed pricing unless it was a reproducible commodity (like infographics used to be, I would charge per graphic) but now that part of my work is prototyping and solving problems it would not work to do anything but hourly

@minimaxir have been thinking a lot about what a human-curation layer on top of AI looks like – if you were to build a tool to do that curation, what would it look like? (or is dual text editors + search ideal?)
@hyphy_republic wait you guys have bagels now
I guess PayPal is our new federal government now? https://t.co/849Ji4NBrp
@CapobiaNB For me it’s “shit’s weird as fuck…… I guess I’ll make sure it’s well documented???”

I don’t know about you, but I remote work from a city where I have human interaction every day, and even when I didn’t, I already had friends I could see. I guess this might be true if your only friends are coworkers? https://t.co/80991QpnSD

@dataeditor having recently taken a 15 hour train ride that I was excited for, midway through I thought "oh, this is just basically a 15 hour flight" so just take that into consideration, if you wouldn't do that amount of time on a plane, don't do it on a train

@eharfenist YES

I mean, for certain things, I get different photogs get different angles / perspectives / moments. But press conference visuals don't change
As I watch livestream of Obama's last press conference: why are still photographers constantly shooting photos?

RT @Lowpolybot: @neural_tv Your picture is ready:
#sudivision #gradient #noedges https://t.co/275r3rYYfU
I've never sounded like an old man more, but: stop crowdfunding your efforts to protest. Get a job, organize, be self-sufficient.
I feel like I spend more time than the average person explaining the different line systems of coffee shops to new patrons
RT @juliagalef: Seems like a generally useful sign. https://t.co/i8RN9qZhOH
@NancyPettit @ElementOwners Thanks so much! Pushing 175k now, I think.
@Joshochos appreciate it
@EricMarkowitz thank you man!
Right now I’m most excited to get my car from the shop and drive it around. Manual transmission ‘03 Honda Element. Love that thing.
Bags are all packed. Got some final errands to run and chores to do but ready to get on the road. Have been preparing for 8+ months. https://t.co/GBicsgRSgM
So excited. In 2 days I will start my roadtrip. Will be driving across the US until April listening, reading, photographing & talking.
Jesus christ https://t.co/p7VSGkAVbf https://t.co/w2GS8nighY

My first year in New York City was focused on financial and physical health. 

2016 is about mental and spiritual health.
“Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate, only love can do that.“
My favorite train is when the L impersonates the J
RT @thefader: The music world mourns late @ASAPMOB founder ASAP Yams. http://t.co/MLyqBuO5z6 http://t.co/wJbo5nJB9e

RT @OaklandElle: "Hmm... helicopters... wonder what that's about..."
*checks Twitter*
@OaklandElle Oakland is 100% responsible for this habit, for me, do it everywhere now though
Felt so much better after walking around SF for a few days, thinking my lack of exercise is an issue. Got a new FitBit and wifi scale.
OH NO “@bitcoinprice: The average price of bitcoin on all exchanges is now  USD”
My brain is fully capable of operating in both PST and EST simultaneously. I feel that this is a 1/5th the skill of being bilingual.
@soffes Hey, I remember you saying you had an NDA as part of your freelancer contract? Any chance you'd be willing to share that section?
@The_PHP_Jedi Do you know the name of the EFF activist who said 29 congressmen changed their positions?
I love coding but, how did it get to be 11:30PM already?
playing a little Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2. http://raptr.com/pseudoplacebo
My computers gets surprisingly speedy when I am not running a trillion things at once on it!
Stupid system update making me quit iTunes. Like the vet making me shoot a puppy. NOT COOL.
I also posted a new This American Infographic yesterday (even though I've been so busy!) - http://tai.ejfox.com/006-christmas/
I think there is beauty anywhere there is human effort.
Checking in! RT @gregoryng Me too RT @wineaccguy: This guy is. RT @sarkatbur: Who else is working today?
I don't really know what it means that my alarm rarely wakes me up anymore. It's usually just an annoying sound when I'm working.
Here's 1 step Obama could take to open up government 1000% - mandate all gov released info be available in HTML + PDF. Done.
OH MY GOD I'M LIVING ENDER'S GAME.
Ender's Game / Speaker For the Dead / Xenocide / etc DEFINITELY impacted how I approach & live life. I don't think that's a bad thing.
Gonna clean my room.
accomplished nothing this entire weekend, except a weird song last night, hurray
4chan makes me miss HackThisSite more than most things...
I miss watching football games. =[
Laying in bed listening to Ender's Game. Feeling accomplished.
I think Adium is the application that is nearest and dearest to my heart. Isn't that odd, strange, AND sad?
This photograph is wonderful: http://is.gd/giER
I think the true test of musical love: "Is there a sum of money someone could sell me to never listen to this group again?" If so? No love.
LOVE MORE. TWEET LESS.
Slept for a little while. Still feel like crap.

posts.title: Hidden Networks Of Warmth
posts.dek: In which our Narrator contemplates the Art of Preparation whilst tending to his Wood-stove, discovers Hidden Networks of Motorcyclists and Radio Operators in the Hudson Valley, and arrives at certain Conclusions regarding the Nature of Community and Service
